Text.Text: Aahhh...  Do come in, fine adventurers...

My name is Yquog, to answer the first part of your question.  What I am is a barghest whelp.  And do not look upon me and make rash judgments, adventurer - believe me when I say you look exceptionally foul to mine eyes as I probably do to yours.
*What would I have of you,* you ask?  An interesting choice of words.  Under normal circumstances, I would have you for one of my meals.
Yes.  I must say you have a gift for observing the obvious.  But enough of this idle banter.  I have a task for you.  Are you interested?
Why is it that you adventurers are always wondering what's in it for you?  Couldn't you, just this once, perform a task without asking how it benefits you?

Fine!  I'll tell you how it benefits you, but only after I explain what it is I want you to do.  As of this moment, a wretched little dekanter goblin, who goes by the name Kruntur, is withholding a very important message for me written by my masters.  If I fail to carry out what is on that message, I will invoke the wrath of my masters - a wrath even a creature such as myself would be terrified to endure.

Personally, I don't care how you go about retrieving my message.  However, my masters would prefer that the dekanter goblins, in particular Kruntur, stay alive long enough to carry out their missions.  So, if you could get back that message without killing Kruntur, I would be most appreciative.

Well, uh, it's rather silly, really.  As I said, I'm a barghest whelp.  Normally, barghest whelps come to this plane to consume strong, virile beings to absorb their life force, which, in turn, makes us stronger.

However, my masters summoned me to this plane just before I was old enough to make the journey on my own.  Because of this fact, I am not yet mature enough to do anything other than obey my masters.  I have been ordered about and used during this whole campaign, but I will not protest for fear of what would happen to me.

Right.  Well, it's no secret that I have a voracious appetite, and, quite frankly, dog and cattle meat was just not enough.  So, one day while I was wandering through the upper goblin warrens, I came across Kruntur's younger brother, Krunbar.  He was a strong dekanter goblin, but not as strong as Kruntur.

Since no one was looking, and I was so very hungry for a being with some substance, I ate him.  It's not like the brothers were very fond of each other!  Besides, I was due for a reward after helping the masters create the half-goblins!
Blast it!  See what hunger does to me?  Say no more about it!  Just do this task for me and I will give you a fine magical item that I took off a less agreeable adventurer.

A wise choice.  You will find Kruntur on the next level, through the passage northeast of here.  On that level, you will find his camp on the west side.  However, I currently have both entrances to his camp blockaded with my minions.  You will need the password, *Xvim,* to pass.

Do not try my patience, fleshy mortal!  I told you that I wish to say no more on the matter!  If you choose to help me, then you will be rewarded.  If you choose not to help me, then you should make a fine meal!  What will it be?
Yes, yes, your reward.  If you do this task for me, I shall bestow upon you a magical item that I found on a less agreeable adventurer.
What else do you want?

Well, uh, it's rather silly, really.  As I said, I'm a barghest whelp.  Normally, barghest whelps come to this plane to consume strong, virile beings to absorb their life force, which, in turn, makes us stronger.

However, my masters summoned me to this plane just before I was old enough to make the journey on my own.  Because of this fact, I am not yet mature enough to do anything other than obey my masters.  I have been ordered about and used during this whole campaign, but I will not protest for fear of what would happen to me.

Right.  Well, it's no secret that I have a voracious appetite, and, quite frankly, dog and cattle meat was just not enough.  So, one day while I was wandering through the upper goblin warrens, I came across Kruntur's younger brother, Krunbar.  He was a strong dekanter goblin, but not as strong as Kruntur.

Since no one was looking, and I was so very hungry for a being with some substance, I ate him.  It's not like the brothers were very fond of each other!  Besides, I was due for a reward after helping the masters create the half-goblins!
Blast it!  See what hunger does to me?  Forget that last part!
Do not try my patience, mortal!  I told you that I wish to say no more on the matter!

You will find Kruntur on the next level, through the passage northeast of here.  On that level, you will find his camp on the west side.  However, I currently have both entrances to his camp blockaded with my minions.  You will need the password, Xvim, to pass.
Ah, you're back.  Do you have my message?
::Sniff::  Yes, you speak the truth.  I do not smell the blood of dekanter goblins.  Despite my hatred for the little wretch, it will please the masters that he and his brood still breathe.
I will not tell you, adventurer, so do not try my patience by asking me again.  Here is your reward for aiding me.  Now leave before I lose my good nature and have you for today's meal!
Well, don't just stare at me like a rat to a hawk, speak!  Do you have my message?  ::sniff::  Wait, I smell dekanter goblin blood...  You killed Kruntur, didn't you?!
Well, did you recover my message?

BAHAHAHA!  Typical, arrogant, lying little dekanter goblin!  Let me explain something about the *Tamjan's Bracers* - that is their proper title, you know. Those bracers didn't originally belong to Krunbar.  Krunbar stole them off the dead body of a Neverwinter scout after his raiding party intercepted the scout's party on the roads.  I merely took something that didn't belong to him in the first place.
::RAWRGH!::  May Bane's sweat eat through Kruntur's flesh and bone!  Fine!  Take them!  They're too small for me, anyways!  If the masters weren't so powerful, I would have consumed Kruntur long ago!
I'll be waiting, fleshy mortal...
You fool!  The masters will find out I had something to do with Kruntur's death and torture me!  RHARRR!  I will consume your soul, fleshy mortal!

BAHAHAHA!  Typical, arrogant, lying little dekanter goblin!  Let me explain something about the *Tamjan's Bracers* - that is their proper title, you know. Those bracers didn't originally belong to Krunbar.  Krunbar stole them off the dead body of a Neverwinter scout after his raiding party intercepted the scout's party on the roads.  I merely took something that didn't belong to him in the first place.

Hmmm, I'm feeling rather generous today - lucky you.  I would be willing to part with the bracers if that little toad will give me what belongs to me - my message scroll from the masters.  Bring me my message and I will not only let you live, but I will give you a substantial reward.
A reasonable request.  But be warned, fleshy mortal, that if you cheat me on this in any way, I will summon demon kin to hunt you down!  Understood?
Do not bother me anymore, fleshy mortal.  I have no more use for you - unless you are willing to sacrifice yourself to me to help quench my hunger!
Well, don't just stare at me like a rat to a hawk, speak!  Do you have my message?  ::sniff::  Wait, I smell dekanter goblin blood...  You killed Kruntur, didn't you?!
Well, don't just stare at me like a rat to a hawk, speak!  ::sniff::  Wait, I smell goblin whelp blood...  You killed Ilquog, didn't you?!  You will die for this betrayal, fleshy mortal!
Well, don't just stare at me like a rat to a hawk, speak!  ::sniff::  Wait, I smell goblin whelp blood...  You killed Tequog, didn't you?!  You will die for this betrayal, fleshy mortal!

Well, don't just stare at me like a rat to a hawk, speak!  ::sniff::  Wait, I smell goblin whelp blood...  You killed both Ilquog and Tequog, didn't you?!  What's wrong with you, fleshy mortal?  Wasn't killing hordes of goblins, orcs, forest animals and anything else that gave you funny looks enough?  Hmm, but your life essence could make me a mature Barghest Whelp!  Come to Yquog!
::Sniff!::  You killed that little wretch, Kruntur!  I will be blamed for that, you foolish fleshy mortal!  I'LL KILL YOU!

As of this moment, a wretched little dekanter goblin, who goes by the name Kruntur, is withholding a very important message for me written by my masters.  If I fail to carry out what is on that message, I will invoke the wrath of my masters - a wrath even a creature such as myself would be terrified to endure.
You were wise to run from my minions, Iquog and Tequog, but truely foolish to come back to me, and think I would let you live.  Prepare to be consumed!
Who, or *what,* are you?
I don't have the time to converse with a demon such as you.  Prepare to die!
Fair enough.  What would you have of me, Yquog?
Ah yes, Kruntur sent me to get his dead brother's bracers back from you.  Do you still have Krunbar's bracers?
You're obviously a part of what is going on around these parts.  I must slay you as I have all the others.
So I take it these are not your normal circumstances?
I don't have time for this.  Prepare to die!
That depends.  What is the task, and more importantly, what's in it for me?
That depends.  What's the task?
That depends.  What's the task?
I do not work with demons!  Prepare to die.
No.
We adventurers are also always killing creatures such as you.  Here, let me show you.
Go on.
Enough. I care not for your plight.  Prepare to die!
Tell me why he is withholding your message.
And what do I get out of this?
Enough. I care not for your plight.  Prepare to die!
I'm listening.
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
Get to the point.
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
I think I see where this is going.  Continue.
Stop!  You don't have to tell me any more!  Die, beast!
You created the half-goblins?!
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
A magical item, huh?  Fine, I will do this task for you.  Where is this Kruntur?
I will not forget that last part!  What part did you have with the creation of those half-goblins?
I have heard enough.  Prepare to die!
That is all I need.  I shall return with your message, Yquog.
Forget it!  Prepare to die!
Threats are not necessary - I will help you.  Where is this Kruntur?
Back to the abyss then, Yquog!  I will not aid you if it aids this horde's attacks on the Ten Towns!
A magical item, huh?  Fine, I will do this task for you.  Where is this Kruntur?
Forget it!  Prepare to die!
Explain to me why Kruntur is withholding your message.
Tell me again where Kruntur is?
Nothing else, thanks.
Forget it!  Prepare to die!
I'm listening.
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
Get to the point.
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
I think I see where this is going.  Continue.
Stop!  You don't have to tell me any more!  Die, beast!
You created the half-goblins?!
Stop!  You are just too vile to let live.  Die, beast!
All right, consider it forgotten.
I will not forget that last part!  What part did you have with the creation of those half-goblins?
I will forget after I have killed you!
Fine, fine, consider the subject dropped.
Back to the abyss then, Yquog!
I have another question.
That is all I need.  I shall return with your message, Yquog.
Forget it!  I changed my mind!
Yes, here it is.  And, you'll be pleased to know that Kruntur still lives.
No, not yet.
Forget it!  I changed my mind!
So, who are the masters you keep referring to?
Then I will trouble you no longer.  Farewell.
You know, Yquog, the reward simply is not enough.  I won't be happy until you and your brood are dead.
Yes, yes I did.  I did not like his demeanor.
Not exactly.  I spoke to Kruntur, and he said that you have something that should go to him - his brother's bracers.
No, I didn't.  Not only that, I'm going to kill you and take the bracers you stole off Krunbar's dead body!
Regardless, Kruntur said that if you want the message from your mysterious masters, that you will have to hand over the *Tamjan's Bracers.*
If you will not surrender the bracers, then I will take them by force.  Prepare to die!
Well... uh, I'll go take these bracers to Kruntur.  I shall return.
Regardless, what is it going to take to get those bracers?
If you will not surrender the bracers, then I will take them by force.  Prepare to die!
Fetch you a message scroll, huh?  You know, so I don't have to wander back and forth a dozen times, would you please give me the bracers, and I swear that I will return with your message.
If you will not surrender the bracers, then I will take them by force.  Prepare to die!
Understood.  I shall return.
Idle threats aren't necessary.  I'll be going.
How about I put you out of your misery, instead?
Yes, yes I did.  I did not like his demeanor.
